newsitem.title: USA: Miami boy travels in style to Jamaica for free.
newsitem.headline: Miami boy travels in style to Jamaica for free.

text.p: Dressed in a T-shirt and cut-off jeans, a 12-year-old boy walked through Miami airport security, boarded an American Airlines plane and flew first-class to Jamaica.
The boy had neither a ticket, money nor a passport. Now his mother, Darlene Livingstone, is seeking to sue American Airlines, the airport and U.S. government agencies.
"It is a very amusing yet dangerous story," lawyer Ellis Rubin told a news conference on Wednesday.

The boy, whose name was not disclosed, began his adventure on May 19 when he walked out of a children's care centre to visit the airport. Without a dime in his pocket, he hopped aboard public transport and an airport shuttle bus.
At the airport he went through security with no one checking for a ticket or passport.
"He didn't intend to fly," Rubin said.
But he joined a passenger line and was ushered on board to a first-class seat on a Jamaica-bound flight. It was only when he landed and tried to get to a resort that he was found out and flown home.
"I don't think he understands the seriousness. He thought it was a fun thing," his mother said.
American Airlines spokeswoman Martha Pantin would not say whether the boy had boarded the aircraft without a ticket.
"The circumstances surrounding this matter are presently under investigation," she said. "We have complete confidence in our security system, which is one of the most extensive in the industry."
